''Stat Aces'' hold loyalties only to ability. They find PokÃ©mon who are the fastest, or the strongest, or the smartest and then, the Stat Ace further improves those abilities. No other Trainer can make a Slowbro act with the Speed of a Ninjask. This focus makes them extremely effective in their element, but might also come with the risk of opening themselves up to weaknesses a more well rounded trainer wouldnâ€™t have as much issue with. However, it doesnâ€™t take many blows from an Attack or Special Attack Ace to knock out a foe, not many can wear down a Defense or Special Defense Ace, and itâ€™s hard to get a leg up on a Speed Ace.<br>
''Stat Ace'', as a Class, allows you to customize PokÃ©mon in ways you typically wouldnâ€™t be able to. By allowing you to bypass Base Stat Relations for a stat, you can raise PokÃ©mon in rather interesting ways, such as having a Gengar focused on physical attacks and taking advantage of its awesome physical movepool. It also allows you to further improve PokÃ©mon who are already specialized in a given stat with innate Combat Stage bonuses, extra Abilities and bonus stats.<br>

* ''Stat Ace''
** [Class] [Branch]
** Prerequisites: Ace Trainer or Style Expert, 1 PokÃ©mon with the chosen stat of 15 or more, Command 3 or Focus 3
** Prerequisites: 3 PokÃ©mon with the chosen stat at 20 or higher, Command 3 or Focus 3
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon have their Chosen Base Stat increased by +1, and by +1 more for every 10 Levels they have (for example, a Level 20 PokÃ©mon would have your Chosen Statâ€™s base value increased by +3). Additionally, your PokÃ©mon may ignore Base Relations, as long as they are adding to the Stat chosen for Stat Ace, and you do not need to â€œcorrectâ€ Stats due to this inflated Stat Value.
** Note: When you take Stat Ace, choose Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, or Speed. This becomes your PokÃ©monâ€™s Chosen Stat. You may take Stat Ace multiple times, choosing different Stats each time. If using Style Expert to qualify for Stat Ace, your Chosen Stat must be the Stat that correlates to your Chosen Contest Stat. Beauty is Special Attack, Cool is Attack, Cute is Speed, Smart is Special Defense, and Tough is Defense.

* ''Stat Link''
** [Branch]
** Prerequisites: Stat Ace
** 1 AP â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: At the end of your PokÃ©monâ€™s turn, their Chosen Stat is at its default number of Combat Stages or less.
** Effect: The triggering PokÃ©mon has gains +1 Combat Stage in your Chosen Stat. (Note: The â€œDefaultâ€ number of Combat Stages is usually 0)

* ''Stat Training''
** [Branch]
** Prerequisites: Stat Ace
** At-Will â€“ Extended Action
** Target: Your PokÃ©mon with at least 1 Tutor Point
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon loses 1 Tutor Point, and learns a Move based on your Chosen Stat, even if your PokÃ©mon cannot normally learn this Move:
*** Attack: Swords Dance or Rage
*** Defense: Iron Defense or Reflect
*** Special Attack: Nasty Plot or Hidden Power
*** Special Defense: Amnesia or Light Screen
*** Speed: Agility or After You

* ''Stat Maneuver''
** [Branch]
** Prerequisites: Stat Ace, Command 4 or Focus 4
** Scene â€“ Free Action
** Effect: Stat Maneuverâ€™s Effect depends on your Chosen Stat:
*** Attack Effect: You may activate this Feature to cause one of your PokÃ©mon to use a Physical â€œMelee, 1-Targetâ€ Move as if its range was â€œMelee, Passâ€ or â€œMelee, 3-Targetsâ€ instead.
*** Defense Effect: You may activate this feature whenever your PokÃ©mon is hit by a Physical Attack to receive the blow as if your PokÃ©monâ€™s Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value.
*** Special Attack Effect: You may activate this Feature to allow your PokÃ©mon to use a Special Burst, Cone, Close Blast, Ranged Blast, or Line of any size as a Burst 1, Cone 2, Close Blast 2, or Line 4 instead.
*** Special Defense Effect: You may activate this feature whenever your PokÃ©mon is hit by a Special Attack to receive the blow as if your PokÃ©monâ€™s Special Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value.
*** Speed Effect: You may activate this Feature at any time to cause your PokÃ©mon to use a Move as Priority or a Priority Move as Priority (Advanced).

* ''Stat Mastery''
** [Branch]
** Prerequisites: Stat Maneuver
** Effect: Stat Masteryâ€™s Effect depends on your Chosen Stat:
*** Attack Effect: When your PokÃ©mon successfully uses a Push, Disarm, or Dirty Trick Combat Maneuver, the target of the Maneuver loses a Tick of Hit Points.
*** Defense Effect: Whenever your PokÃ©mon do not spend their Shift Action to Shift during a turn, they gain +5 Damage Reduction for one full round.
*** Special Attack Effect: The Range of your PokÃ©monâ€™s Special Non-Melee Moves is increased by +2. This does not affect the size of Area-Of-Effect moves (But does affect the range at which you can place Ranged Blasts).
*** Special Defense Effect: Whenever your PokÃ©mon would lose a Tick of Hit Points from Status Afflictions, Weather, or other effects, they lose 5 fewer Hit Points, to a minimum of 1.
*** Speed Effect: Your PokÃ©mon may take Disengage Maneuvers as Swift Actions.

* ''Stat Embodiment''
** [Branch]
** Prerequisites: 4 Stat Ace Features, Command 5 or Focus 5
** 1 AP â€“ Swift Action, Priority (Limited)
** Target: Your PokÃ©mon
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon gains an Ability, based on your Chosen Stat, for the remainder of the Scene. Switching does not end this effect. Stat Embodiment may only grant one Ability to a PokÃ©mon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.
*** Attack Aces give Sheer Force or Defiant
*** Defense Aces give Filter or Battle Armor
*** Special Attack Aces give Tinted Lens or Competitive
*** Special Defense Aces give Multiscale or Tolerance
*** Speed Aces give Speed Boost or Vanguard

* ''Stat Stratagem''
** [Branch] [Order] [Stratagem]
** Prerequisites: Stat Link, Stat Training, Focus 6 or Command 6
** 2 AP â€“ Standard Action
** Target: Your PokÃ©mon
** Effect: While this Feature is Bound, the target has the following bonuses based on your Chosen Stat:
*** Attack Effect: The targetâ€™s damaging Melee Attacks have their Critical Hit Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Attack, up to a maximum of +3.
*** Defense Effect: The target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Paralysis, Sleep, and Freeze for each positive Combat Stage they have in Defense, up to a maximum of +6.
*** Special Attack Effect: The targetâ€™s damaging Ranged Attacks have their Effect Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Attack, up to a maximum of +3.
*** Special Defense Effect: The target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Confusion, Rage, and Infatuation for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Defense, up to a maximum of +6.
*** Speed Effect: The targetâ€™s Movement Capabilities are increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Speed, up to a maximum of +3.






! Persistent Conditions
!! Burn
* Defense -2 CS
* If a Burned target takes a Standard action or is prevented from taking a Standard action, they lose a Tick of Hit Points (1/10) at the end of that turn.
* Fire types are immune
!! Frozen
* The target may not act on their turn and receives no bonuses from evasion.
* At the end of each turn, make a DC 16 save to become cured.
** DC 11 save for Fire-Type PokÃ©mon
** +4 to save rolls in Bright Sunlight
** -2 to save rolls in Hail
* If a Frozen target is hit by a damaging Fire, Fighting, Rock, or Steel attack, they are cured.
* Ice types are immune
!! Paralysis
* Speed -4 CS
* At the beginning of each turn, roll a DC 5 save to act normally. On failure, the afflicted cannot take any Standard, Shift, or Swift actions.
* Electric types are immune
!! Poison
* Special Defense -2 CS
* If a Poisoned target takes a Standard action or is prevented from taking a Standard action, they lose a Tick of Hit Points (1/10) at the end of that turn.
* Poison and Steel types are immune
!! Badly Poisoned
* Same as Poison, but the afflicted loses 5 HP on the first turn. The amount is doubled for each consecutive turn. (5, 10, 20, 40...)
! Volatile Conditions
!! Confused
* roll 1-8, hit self, typeless, phys struggle. automatic hit, resist 1 step.
* roll 9-15, act normally
* roll 16+, cured of confusion
!! Cursed
* -2 Ticks HP every turn target takes a Standard Action
!! Disabled
* One specified move becomes unusable
!! Rage
* Must attempt a Damaging move or Struggle Attack every turn.
* DC 15 Save at end of each turn.
!! Flinch
* Lose next turn
!! Infatuation
* roll 1-10, may not target the triggering entity
* roll 11-18, may act normally
* roll 19+, cured
!! Sleep
* 0 Evasion
* may not take actions except Free/Swift that would cure sleep
* DC 16 save at end of each turn
* Cured when hit by any damaging attack
* Cannot make saves against Rage, Infatuation, Confusion
* Cannot be hurt by confusion
* May be Woken up by any adjacent Ally
!! Bad Sleep
* -2 Ticks every turn target rolls a save against sleep.
!! Suppressed
* Gain no benefit from PP Ups
* The frequency of moves are lowered.
** At-Will becomes EOT
** EOT and Scene x2 become Scene
! Non-Status Conditions
!! Blinded
* -6 AC
* DC 10 Acrobatics to move over rough or slow terrain or become tripped
!! Total Blindness
* -10 AC
* Cannot use moves with Priority or Interrupt
* No awareness of map
* Move Slowly: move as if slowed
* Move Quickly: become tripped if attempting to shift into Blocking, Rough, or Slow Terrain.
!! Slowed
* Movement Halved
!! Stuck
* Ghost Types Immune
* Cannot Shift
* 0 Speed Evasion
!! Trapped
* Ghost Types Immune
* cannot be recalled
!! Tripped
* Must use shift to stand up before making any action
!! Vulnerable
* 0 Evade
!! Fainted
* Can be revived with normal potions outside of battle
!! Temporary Hit Points
* Are not removed by effects that heal status conditions
* Lost if the target is recalled or leaves battle
* Ignored when calculating max HP or any effects based on current HP.
* Do not stack when receiving Temp HP from multiple effects. You gain Temp HP equal to the highest effect. (If you have 10 and an effect would give you 5, you keep only 10 points. If you have 10 and an effect would give you 15, you take 15 points.






''What was once'' a curiosity buried in the ground was tempered by mankind into the foundation of society. Weapons and armor to defend themselves, beams to support their houses, circuitry housed within complex devicesâ€¦ Metal has come a long way since man first discovered it and learned how to alloy it to match or exceed the iron hides of Aggron. The strength of Steel is unyielding to man or mon, and those gifted few who know this better than anyone are the Steelhearts. Possessing immense durability, these men and women are living siege engines, taking any blow and offering an unrelenting assault in turn. They do not yield, they do not break. They are the bone of their swords, the heart of their armor. They know that the hardest metal known to man is no Dragonforce, but the spirit of Steel within themselves and their unlimited blades.<br>

* ''Steelheart''
** [Class] [+Defense] [Weapon]
** Prerequisites: Elemental Connection (Steel), Athletics 3, Focus 3
** Effect: When wielding metal Melee Weapons, you may use Athletics or Focus instead of Combat to determine the Damage Base of your Struggle Attacks, to qualify for a Weaponâ€™s Moves, and to resist Disarm Checks. Whenever your Weapon Attacks hit a foe who has previously hit you with a Melee attack in the same round, the foe loses a Tick of Hit Points.

* ''Champion of Steel''
** [+Defense] [Weapon]
** Prerequisites: Steelheart
** 1 AP â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: You make a Weapon Attack.
** Effect: The attack or Move increases your Defense by 1 Combat Stage on 16+ and you may have it deal Steel-Type Damage if you wish.

* ''Steel Wind''
** [+Defense] [Weapon]
** Prerequisites: Steelheart
** Effect: You learn the Moves Bullet Punch and Metal Claw. You may use these Moves as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.

* ''Reactive Armour''
** [+Defense]
** Prerequisites: Steelheart, Athletics 4 or Focus 4
** Scene x2 â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: You gain an Injury or take a Critical Hit while wearing metallic Armor
** Effect: All foes within a Burst 1 lose Hit Points equal to double your Athletics or Focus Rank, and you gain Damage Reduction equal to double your Athletics or Focus Rank for one full round.

* ''Impenetrable''
** [+Defense]
** Prerequisites: Steelheart, Athletics 5 or Focus 5
** Effect: You gain the Bulletproof Ability.

* ''Master of Arms''
** [+Defense] [Weapon]
** Prerequisites: Steelheart, Athletics 5 or Focus 5
** Effect: You learn the Call to Arms and Unlimited Steel Works Talents.

* ''Call to Arms''
** At-Will â€“ Extended Action
** Target: A Metal Weapon
** Effect: You create a Steelheart Bond with the target Weapon. You may only have one Steelheart Bond at a time; if you create a new Bond, all old Bonds are lost. As a Shift Action, you may beckon your Steelheart Bonded Weapon to your hands if it is within 10 meters. If it is being held by someone else who does not want to let go of the weapon, make an Athletics or Focus vs Athletics Opposed Check. If you win, they their lose grip on your Weapon and it flies to your hand as normal.

* ''Unlimited Steel Works''
** At-Will â€“ Extended Action
** Target: Your Steelheart Bond Weapon
** Effect: You may replace the Move(s) granted by the target Weapon with any other standard Weapon Moves, within Limitations. Weapons may still only grant one Adept and one Master Move at a maximum.

* ''Man of Steel''
** [+Defense] [Weapon]
** Prerequisites: Steelheart, Athletics 6 or Focus 6
** Effect: You learn the Moves Meteor Mash and Kingâ€™s Shield. You may use these Moves as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.






''While'' the supernatural effects of an Elemental Connection arenâ€™t always obvious, those with a Rock Connection show it in a way thatâ€™s pretty gneiss; their skin gets thicker, bones more durable, and overall exhibit more physical endurance than whats considered normal. They also exhibit some limited ability to materialize earthen matter and weaponize it, much like a Rock Type PokÃ©mon . These individuals are known as Stone Warriors, and are often guided since an early age to put their natural skills to use. These earthen guardians make excellent bodyguards, and many corporate fat cats, politicians and celebrities seek them out for employment. Because of this, some might think that these guys are all bark and no bite, but you canâ€™t take the ability to materialize rocks for granite.

* ''Stone Warrior''
** [Class] [+Defense]
** Prerequisites: Elemental Connection (Rock), Combat 3, Survival 3
** Effect: You learn the Moves Rock Tomb and Wide Guard.

* ''Stone Stance''
** [+Defense]
** Prerequisites: Stone Warrior
** Bind 2 AP â€“ Standard Action
** Effect: You adopt one of the stances below, gaining the effects of the stance while this Feature remains bound. You may switch your active Stance as a Standard Action without rebinding your AP. The benefits from this Feature do not apply if you are not standing on a solid surface, such as deep mud or snow, or if you are outright swimming or even flying.
*** Falling Boulder Stance: You gain a +5 bonus to all Damage Rolls, but lose 5 HP from Recoil whenever you hit with an attack.
*** Moon Mountain Stance: Your initiative is lowered by -5, but you gain 5 Damage Reduction and are immune to Push or Pull effects.
*** Roiling Earth Stance: After a successful Intercept action, you may make a Struggle Attack against a foe within range.

* ''Rock Power''
** [Ranked 2] [+Defense]
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Combat 4 or Survival 4
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Combat 5 or Survival 5
** Effect: Each Rank, choose one of Sturdy, Rock Head, Run Up, or Sand Veil. You gain the chosen Ability. If you choose Sand Veil, you may consider sand a â€œsolid surfaceâ€ for the purposes of Stone Stance.

* ''Shards of Stone''
** [+Defense]
** Prerequisites: Combat 5 or Survival 5
** Effect: You learn the Moves Rock Slide and Stealth Rock

* ''Stone Cold Finish''
** [+Defense]
** Prerequisites: Shards of Stone, Combat 6 or Survival 6
** Effect: You learn the Moves Stone Edge and Head Smash.

* ''Stone Stance Mastery''
** [+Defense]
** Prerequisites: Stone Stance, Combat 6 or Survival 6
** Effect: Whenever you bind Stone Stance, you may choose two Stances and apply the effects of both.






''Contest competition'' is stiff. Participants have to be prepared to both strut their stuff and know when to show their best moves. Those who delve deep into this practice and develop a particular style are known as Style Experts. Much like Stat Aces hone in on a particular trait among PokÃ©mon, Style Experts focus on one particular Contest Style â€“ Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough â€“ and strive to embody this ideal, and help their PokÃ©mon do so too. In Battle, Contests, and in life, you can count on Style Experts to act with a certain flavor of flair.<br>
''The Style Expert Class'' is much like Stat Ace in that it focuses on a particular Stat â€“ only from the Contest perspective. This isnâ€™t to say they have no applications outside of Contests, however. Where Stat Ace is all about teaching PokÃ©mon to battle with an emphasis on their Combat Stat, the Style Expert teaches their PokÃ©mon to embody their chosen Contest Stat in ways that can be similarly useful both in and out of battle. Itâ€™s certainly a similar Class, but with a very different flair.<br>

* ''Style Expert''
** [Class] [Branch]
** Prerequisites: 3 PokÃ©mon with 3d6 in a specific certain Contest Stat from Poffins
** Prerequisites: Coordinator, 1 PokÃ©mon with 3d6 in a specific certain Contest Stat from Poffins
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon gain +2d6 to your chosen Contest Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.
** Note: When you take Style Expert, choose from Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough. This becomes your Chosen Contest Stat. You may take Style Expert multiple times, each time choosing a different Contest Stat.

* ''Style Flourish''
** [Branch]
** Prerequisites: 3 Style Expert Features
** 1 AP â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon uses a Move of your Chosen Type
** Contest Effect: Re-Roll all dice that result in 1s. This effect may only be used once per Contest.
** Battle Effect: The target gains +1 CS in the Stat corresponding to your chosen Contest Type, after the Move and all effects have been resolved. This may only affect a target once per Scene.
** Note: As a reminder, Beauty corresponds to Special Attack, Cool corresponds to Attack, Cute corresponds to Speed, Smart corresponds to Special Defense, and Tough corresponds to Defense.

* ''Style Entrainment''
** [Branch]
** Prerequisites: 4 Style Expert Features
** 1 AP â€“ Swift Action, Priority (Limited)
** Target: Your PokÃ©mon
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon gains one of the following Abilities corresponding to your chosen Contest Stat for the rest of the Scene, even if it is switched out. Style Entrainment may only grant one Ability to a PokÃ©mon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.
*** Beauty gives Gentle Vibe or Serene Grace
*** Cool gives Defiant or Sniper
*** Cute gives Cute Charm or Cute Tears
*** Smart gives Analytic or Anticipation
*** Tough gives Sturdy or Intimidate

! Beauty Expert Features

* ''Beautiful Ballet''
** [Ranked 2]
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Style Expert, Beauty as Chosen Stat, Intuition 3
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Intuition 5
** 1 AP â€“ Special
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon with at least 3d6 in their Beauty Stat from Poffins may activate Beautiful Ballet as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.
*** Rank 1: Captivate, Mist
*** Rank 2: Lovely Kiss, Mean Look

* ''Fabulous Max''
** Prerequisites: Beautiful Ballet Rank 1
** At-Will â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon uses a Beauty-Type Move
** Contest Effect: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
** Battle Effect: The move gains the keyword Burst 1 if Melee, or Blast 2 if ranged. If the move is already a Burst, Blast, or Cone, increase the size of the Moveâ€™s Range by 1. This does not cause a target to be hit multiple times. You may activate Fabulous Max only once per PokÃ©mon per Scene.

* ''Enticing Beauty''
** Prerequisites: Beautiful Ballet Rank 1
** Scene â€“ Free Action
** Target: Your PokÃ©mon
** Effect: The target acts as a Bait item as if it had the Alluring Capability. Add its number of Beauty Dice from Poffins as a Bonus to all d20 lure rolls.

! Cool Expert Features

* ''Cool Conduct''
** [Ranked 2]
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Style Expert, Cool as Chosen Stat, Command 3
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Command 5
** 1 AP â€“ Special
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon with at least 3d6 in their Cool Stat from Poffins may activate Cool Conduct as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.
*** Rank 1: Focus Energy, Noble Roar
*** Rank 2: Roar, Double Team

* ''Rule of Cool''
** Prerequisites: Cool Conduct Rank 1
** At-Will â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon uses a Cool-Type Move
** Contest Effect: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
** Battle Effect: The triggering Moveâ€™s Crit Range is increased by 3, and the Moves with the Interrupt Keyword may not be activated in reaction to this Move. You may activate Rule of Cool only once per PokÃ©mon per Scene.

* ''Action Hero Stunt''
** Prerequisites: Cool Conduct Rank 1
** Daily x2 â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon makes a Skill Check for a dramatic, high risk action
** Effect: Instead of using a Skill for this Check, your PokÃ©mon rolls their Cool Dice from Poffins and adds their number of Cool Dice from Stats as a modifier. For example, a PokÃ©mon with 5d6 Cool from Poffins and 2d6 from Attack rolls 5d6+2. Skill Checks invoked by Intercepting attacks, Combat Maneuvers, Moves, and Abilities donâ€™t trigger this Feature.
** Example Trigger: Charging into a burning building for a heroic rescue.
** Note: To decide whether an action triggers Action Hero Stunt, ask yourself if there are dramatic consequences for the outcome and if the player chose a risky and cool option over safer alternatives.

! Cute Expert Features

* ''Cute Cuddle''
** [Ranked 2]
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Style Expert, Cute as Chosen Stat, Charm 3
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Charm 5
** 1 AP â€“ Special
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon with at least 3d6 in their Cute Stat from Poffins may activate Cute Cuddle as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.
*** Rank 1: Charm, Block
*** Rank 2: Teeter Dance, Attract

* ''Gleeful Steps''
** Prerequisites: Cute Cuddle Rank 1
** At-Will â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon uses a Cute-Type Move
** Contest Effect: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
** Battle Effect: The triggering PokÃ©mon may immediately shift up to half their Movement speed in meters in any direction after their attack is resolved. You may activate Gleeful Steps only once per PokÃ©mon per Scene.

* ''Letâ€™s Be Friends!''
** Prerequisites: Cute Cuddle Rank 1
** Scene â€“ Free Action
** Target: Your PokÃ©mon
** Effect: The target may attempt to improve the disposition of a Wild PokÃ©mon as if making a Charm Check. They roll their Cute Dice from Poffins and add their number of Cute Dice from Stats as a modifier. For example, a PokÃ©mon with 4d6 Cute from Poffins and 3d6 Cute from Speed rolls 4d6+3 in place of a Charm Check.

! Smart Expert Features

* ''Smart Scheme''
** [Ranked 2]
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Style Expert, Smart as Chosen Stat, Guile 3
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Guile 5
** 1 AP â€“ Special
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon with at least 3d6 in their Smart Stat from Poffins may activate Smart Scheme as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.
*** Rank 1: Fake Tears, Calm Mind
*** Rank 2: Taunt, Flatter

* ''Calculated Assault''
** Prerequisites: Smart Scheme Rank 1
** At-Will â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon uses a Smart-Type Move
** Contest Effect: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
** Battle Effect: Choose one: The triggering PokÃ©mon gains a +1 bonus on its Accuracy Roll for each ally that hit a target of its Move this round, or all allies get a +1 bonus to their Accuracy Rolls against targets of the triggering PokÃ©monâ€™s Move until the end of your PokÃ©monâ€™s next turn. You may activate Calculated Assault only once per PokÃ©mon per Scene.

* ''Learn From Your Mistakes''
** Prerequisites: Smart Scheme Rank 1
** Daily x3 â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon fails a Skill Check.
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon may re-roll the Skill Check with a Bonus equal to its number of Smart Dice from Poffins.

! Tough Expert Features

* ''Tough Tumble''
** [Ranked 2]
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Style Expert, Tough as Chosen Stat, Intimidate 3
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Intimidate 5
** 1 AP â€“ Special
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon with at least 3d6 in their Tough Stat from Poffins may activate Tough Tumble as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.
*** Rank 1: Scary Face, Spite
*** Rank 2: Glare, Bide

* ''Macho Charge''
** Prerequisites: Tough Tumble Rank 1
** At-Will â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon uses a Tough-Type Move
** Contest Effect: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.
** Battle Effect: All targets hit by the Move are pushed away from the triggering PokÃ©mon by 3 meters. You may activate Macho Charge only once per PokÃ©mon per Scene.

* ''Endurance''
** Prerequisites: Tough Tumble Rank 1
** Scene â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon takes falling damage, begins to suffocate, or is Heavily Injured.
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon can ignore up to X meters of falling when calculating falling damage, act without beginning to suffocate for X additional rounds, or ignore the Hit Point loss effects from acting while Heavily Injured for X rounds. X is equal to half its number of Tough Dice from Poffins.






.tc-subtitle {display:none;}






''PokÃ©mon Trainers'' often have to travel across the land, searching far and wide to capture new PokÃ©mon or find Gyms to challenge. Their journeys bring them through all sorts of exotic environments, from frozen tundras to steamy rainforests. Not everyone is cut out for such a harsh journey, but the Survivalist is most at home trailblazing through the wilderness.<br>
''However'', even the most seasoned traveler canâ€™t master all the different terrains and environments of the world. It takes a concerted effort for a Survivalist to truly understand a type of geography and how best to navigate through it, so each Survivalist will pick up the skills that are most appropriate to their favored terrains. Their expertise lets them create improvised traps, fight with the environment, and help their allies acclimate to their surroundings in battle.<br>

* ''Survivalist''
** [Class] [+HP]
** Prerequisites: Survival 3
** One Time Use â€“ Extended Action
** Effect: Choose a Terrain in which you have spent at least three nights. You gain Naturewalk for that terrain and a +2 bonus to Athletics, Acrobatics, Stealth, Perception, and Survival Checks in that terrain.
** When you have 2 Survivalist Features, you may choose a second Terrain. When you have 4 Survivalist Features, you may choose a third terrain. When you have 6 Survivalist Features, you may choose a fourth terrain.
** The terrains are: Grassland, Forest, Wetlands, Ocean, Tundra, Mountain, Cave, Urban, Desert

* ''Natural Fighter''
** [+HP]
** Prerequisites: Survivalist
** 1 AP â€“ Special
** Effect: You and your PokÃ©mon become adept at using the environment to your advantage in battle. You or your PokÃ©mon may activate Natural Fighter as a Standard Action to use the Move below corresponding to the current terrain. You and your PokÃ©mon must still follow all Frequency limitations for the Move.
** Grassland: Cotton Spore; Forest: Grass Whistle; Wetlands: Mud Slap; Ocean: Aqua Ring; Tundra: Haze; Mountain: Smack Down; Cave: Astonish; Urban: Fling; Desert: Sand Attack
** Note: GMs! Donâ€™t be super duper strict about the terrains here. Obviously a beach is analogous enough to a desert to use Sand Attack, and a lake can count as ocean terrain. In urban terrain, thereâ€™ll probably at least be trash around to Fling with the standard 6 DB option. On the other hand, most standard arenas for League matches wonâ€™t qualify for any of the terrains. However, some arenas may be specifically designed to emulate a terrain type, such as a rocky stadium or a set of floating platforms in a pool.

* ''Trapper''
** [+HP]
** Prerequisites: Survivalist, Survival 4
** Daily x2 â€“ Extended Action
** Effect: You create a consumable item that creates 8 meters of Hazard within 6 meters. All 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of the Hazard.
** These Hazards cause foes that run into them to become Slowed until the end of their next turn and have an additional effect based on the terrain in which the item was made. When foes run into these Hazards, they are destroyed after their effects resolve. PokÃ©mon and Trainers with Naturewalk for the terrains associated with a Hazard are immune to its effects. These items must be used the same day they are created or they lose all effect.
*** Dust Trap â€“ Grassland or Desert: A foe that runs into this Hazard is Blinded until the end of their next turn.
*** Tangle Trap â€“ Forest or Wetlands: A foe that runs into this Hazard is must immediately stop Shifting, and they are Stuck instead of Slowed until the end of their next turn.
*** Slick Trap â€“ Ocean or Tundra: A foe that runs into this Hazard becomes Vulnerable until the end of their next Turn.
*** Abrasion Trap â€“ Mountain, Cave, or Urban: A foe that runs into this Hazard lowers their Defense and Special Defense by 1 Combat Stage.

* ''Wilderness Guide''
** [+HP] [Orders]
** Prerequisites: Survivalist, Survival 5
** Scene x3 â€“ Standard Action
** Effect: Wilderness Guideâ€™s effect depends on your current terrain.
*** Grassland or Forest: All allies gain the Stealth Capability and a +2 bonus to their Overland Speed for one full round.
*** Ocean or Wetlands: All allies gain 5 Damage Reduction and a +2 bonus to their Swim Speed for one full round.
*** Desert or Tundra: All allies do not lose Hit Points from Weather and ignore the effects of foesâ€™ Sand Veil and Snow Cloak Abilities for one full round.
*** Mountain or Cave: All allies do not trigger Hazards and are not Blinded in Low-Light conditions for one full round.
*** Urban: All allies gain +1 Evasion and a +2 bonus on Accuracy Rolls and Skill Checks to perform the Dirty Trick and Manipulate Combat Maneuvers for one full round.

* ''Terrain Talent''
** [Ranked 2] [+HP]
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Survivalist, 2 Mastered Terrains
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Survivalist, 4 Mastered Terrains
** Effect: Each Rank, you gain two Terrain Talents, chosen from the Terrains for which you gained  Naturewalk from Survivalist.
** Note: You do not have to be in the corresponding terrain to take advantage of Terrain Talents! They work everywhere.

* ''Adaptive Geography''
** [+HP]
** Prerequisites: 4 Survivalist Features, Survival 6
** Scene x2 â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: You or your PokÃ©mon gain Initiative
** Effect: The triggering target takes their turn as if they were in a terrain adjacent to the terrain they are in on the following list. For example, if you are standing in Wetlands terrain, you may act as if you are standing in Forest or Ocean Terrain. This affects Survivalist Features, Naturewalk Capabilities, Moves with the Environ Keyword, etc.
** Adjacent Terrain: Grassland >> Forest >> Wetlands >> Ocean >> Tundra >> Mountain >> Cave >> Urban >> Desert >> Grassland

! Terrain Talents

* ''Plains Runner â€“ Grassland Terrain''
** Effect: Your Overland Speed is increased by +2. You gain a +2 bonus to Perception Checks to spot or identify objects in the far distance.

* ''Forest Ranger â€“ Forest Terrain''
** Effect: Youâ€™re used to navigating the dense plant life of large forests. You gain the Stealth Capability.

* ''Marsh Stomper â€“ Wetland Terrain''
** Effect: You can handle the toxic fauna and flora of the marshes. You do not lose Hit Points from Poison and lose only 1 instead of 2 Combat Stages from Poison. You still count as Poisoned for the purpose of Moves and effects.

* ''Deep Diver â€“ Ocean Terrain''
** Effect: You love nothing better than the smell of the sea. Your Swimming Capability is equal to your Overland Capability instead of half. Additionally, you may hold your breath underwater for a number of minutes equal to your Survival Rank before you start suffocating.

* ''Arctic Pilgrim â€“ Tundra Terrain''
** Effect: Neither deep slow nor slippery ice can deter you. You are immune to the effects of Hail and to the Frozen condition, and gain 5 Damage Reduction against Ice-Type attacks.

* ''Surefooted â€“ Mountain Terrain''
** Effect: Youâ€™re not afraid of precarious ledges and steep hills. You gain a +2 Bonus to Skill Checks made to climb, balance, or maintain footing â€“ including resisting Push and Trip maneuvers. Whenever you take falling damage, ignore one meter and receive one less Injury when determining damage.

* ''Cave Dweller â€“ Cave Terrain''
** Effect: Your eyes are used to very low levels of light. You do not suffer Blindness for being in Low-Light conditions. If you would be Totally Blinded by complete darkness, you instead suffer the penalties of Blindness, and may make Survival Checks instead of Acrobatics to avoid becoming Tripped. You are immune to Stealth Rock Hazards.

* ''Traceur â€“ Urban Terrain''
** Effect: The city is your jungle. You gain a +1 Bonus to your Jump Capabilities. Add half your Survival Rank to your Evasion against Push, Trip, and Attack of Opportunity Maneuvers.

* ''Dune Walker â€“ Desert Terrain''
** Effect: Your long hours in the unforgiving desert have made you inured to sand and heat. Youâ€™re immune to the effects of Sandstorm, Sand-Attack, and Sand Tomb, and you gain 5 Damage Reduction against Fire-Type attacks.






''Some trainers'' like to collect Bug PokÃ©mon, and support them in battle. Others instead seek to emulate and command them. Swarmlords are trainers who have undergone a manifestation of Bug-type elemental power, taking on either the aspects of the arachnid hunters, or the traits of the proud, winged monarchs. Such manifestations are not always physically apparent, but the Swarmlord may take on certain features when using their powers - whether it be their eyes splitting to have multiple irises, or sprouting tiny hairs from their fingertips. Swarmlords tend to be resourceful and charismatic individuals, and can be utterly relentless in battle - striking again and again while emitting pheromones that subtly guide their attacks towards the enemyâ€™s weak points - and teaching them what happens when you try and take on a Swarm.<br>

* ''Swarmlord''
** [Class]
** Prerequisites: Elemental Connection (Bug), Survival 3, Command 3
** Effect: Your powers begin to take after either Arachnid's Embrace or Monarch's Embrace. Depending on your Embrace, you gain an Ability and Stat Tag. Whenever you gain a Swarmlord Feature, you gain the same Stat Tag.
*** Arachnid's Embrace - Unnerve - [+Attack]
*** Monarch's Embrace - Shield Dust - [+Special Attack]

* ''How To Shoot Web''
** Prerequisites: Swarmlord
** Effect: You gain the Threaded and Wallclimber Capabilities.

* ''Enhanced Embrace''
** Rank 1 Prerequisites: Swarmlord
** Rank 2 Prerequisites: Command 4 or Survival 4
** Rank 3 Prerequisites: Command 5 or Survival 5
** Effect: Learn two Moves from the list below at the Rank of Enhanced Embrace you are taking or lower. Moves marked with an Embrace require that Embrace to be chosen.
**<table>
<tr><th>Rank 1 Moves</th><th>Rank 2 Moves</th><th>Rank 3 Moves</th></tr>
<tr><td>
<tr><th>Move</th><th>Prerequisites</th></tr>
<tr><td>Defend Order</td><td>None</td></tr>
<tr><td>Fury Cutter</td><td>None</td></tr>
<tr><td>Fell Needle</td><td>None</td></tr>
<tr><td>Struggle Bug</td><td>Monarch</td></tr>
<tr><td>Sticky Web</td><td>Arachnid</td></tr>
</td><td>
<tr><th>Move</th><th>Prerequisites</th></tr>
<tr><td>Attack Order</td><td>Arachnid</td></tr>
<tr><td>Infestation</td><td>None</td></tr>
<tr><td>Powder</td><td>Monarch</td></tr>
<tr><td>Signal Beam</td><td>None</td></tr>
<tr><td>Steamroller</td><td>None</td></tr>
</td><td>
<tr><th>Move</th><th>Prerequisites</th></tr>
<tr><td>Bug Buzz</td><td>None</td></tr>
<tr><td>Mega Horn</td><td>None</td></tr>
<tr><td>Quiver Dance</td><td>Monarch</td></tr>
<tr><td>Spider Web</td><td>Arachnid</td></tr>
</td></tr>
</table>

* ''Pheromone Markers''
** Prerequisites: Enhanced Embrace Rank 1
** 1 AP â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: You hit a foe with a damaging Bug-Type attack
** Effect: The triggering foe gains 1 Pheromone Stack. Your Bug-Type attacks gain a +2 bonus to Accuracy Rolls and +1 Critical Hit range against foes for each Pheromone Stack they have. Once per Scene per foe, when they gain their third or higher Pheromone Stack, you may choose to roll 1d6.
*** On a result of 1 or 2, the foe becomes Confused
*** On a result of 3 or 4 the foe becomes Suppressed
*** On a result of 5 or 6 the foe becomes Enraged

* ''Broodlord''
** Prerequisites: Enhanced Embrace Rank 2, Command 5 or Survival 5
** Effect: You gain the following Ability based on your Embrace.
*** Arachnidâ€™s Embrace: Tinted Lens
*** Monarchâ€™s Embrace: Compound Eyes

<<toc-selective-expandable 'TableOfContents'>>

</div>






''Taskmasters'' are known for their brutal and demanding style, pushing their PokÃ©mon harder in training than most other Trainers would dare. Many assume that Taskmasters rule their PokÃ©mon through threats and abuse, but some Taskmasters have a deeper understanding with their PokÃ©mon, who accept and embrace their grueling training regimes. However, the sad truth is others do indeed mistreat their PokÃ©mon and rule through fear, instilling in them an overwhelming need to achieve victory in order to avoid harsh consequences.<br>
''Regardless'' of their methods, it canâ€™t be denied that the results are effective. Their brutal training produces brutal PokÃ©mon that can better fight through the pain of battle and use cruel techniques on their opponents with devastating effect.<br>
''Many'' Taskmasters are Ace Trainers, but they can come from all walks of life; Rogues, Roughnecks, and Tough Experts are especially apt to become Taskmasters.<br>

* ''Taskmaster''
** [Class]
** Prerequisites: Brutal Training, Novice Intimidate
** At-Will â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: You apply Brutal Training as a Training action
** Effect: You may grant your PokÃ©mon up to three injuries. If your PokÃ©mon has at least one Injury, it becomes Hardened.
** ''Mechanic â€“ Hardened''
** Hardened Pokemon receive the following benefits:
*** They do not lose Hit Points from acting while Heavily Injured
*** Injuries beyond the 5th do not lower their Maximum Hit Points
*** If they have 1 or more injuries, they gain +1 to Critical Hit and Effect Range.
*** If they have 3 or more injuries, they gain +1 Evasion and +5 to Initiative.
*** If they have 5 or more injuries, they gain +5 Damage Reduction.
*** If they have 7 or more injuries, they are immune to Loss of Hit Points (but not damage) from all effects.
*** If they have 9 or more injuries, they resist all damage one step further.

* ''Quick Healing''
** Prerequisites: Taskmaster
** At-Will â€“ Extended Action
** Effect: Your Hardened PokÃ©mon may use Quick Healing to remove up to three injuries, and gains two Ticks of Hit Points for each Injury removed this way.
** Note: The Injury Removal from this Feature counts as Natural Healing, and thus counts against the total number of Injuries that can be removed in a day.

* ''Savage Strike''
** Prerequisites: Taskmaster
** At-Will â€“ Extended Action
** Target: Your PokÃ©mon with at least 2 Tutor Points
** Effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and gains the Cruelty Ability.

* ''Strike of the Whip''
** Prerequisites: Taskmaster, Press
** At-Will â€“ Swift Action
** Trigger: You use Press
** Effect: You may apply 1 or more of the following effects to the PokÃ©mon hit by Press:
*** Give the target 1 Injury and a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.
*** Spend 1 AP and cure the target of Confusion, Infatuation, Rage, and Suppression.
*** Use an [Order] you know with targets on the target as a Free Action.

* ''Pain Resistance''
** Prerequisites: Taskmaster, Intimidate 4
** 1 AP â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon with 1 or more injuries takes Damage
** Effect: Your PokÃ©mon gains X Damage Reduction against the triggering attack, where X is its Tick Value multiplied by the number of Injuries it has. This may be triggered once per Scene per PokÃ©mon.

* ''Press On!''
** Prerequisites: Taskmaster, Intimidate 5
** Effect: Your Hardened Pokemon gain the following benefits, based on your Intimidate Rank
*** Expert (5): When your Pokemon Faints, you may pay 1 AP. If you do, your Pokemon Faints at -30% Hit Points instead.
*** Master (6): While acting at 0 Hit Points or less, your Pokemonâ€™s Critical Hit, Effect Range, Evasion, Initiative, Damage Reduction, and Resistance Bonuses from being Hardened are doubled.
**Note: PokÃ©mon cannot use the Moves Explosion, Endure, Pain Split, or Self-Destruct while they have 0 Hit Points or less. PokÃ©mon with the Soulless capability cannot benefit from Press On!

* ''Desperate Strike''
** Prerequisites: Savage Strike, Intimidate 5
** Scene x2 â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon triggers Cruelty, or scores a Critical Hit with damaging attack.
** Effect: Your Pokemon may apply the effects of Cruelty to the attack without expending Crueltyâ€™s Frequency.
** Crueltyâ€™s effects may be purchased as if the foe had additional injuries equal to the number of injuries on the user. Desperate Strike may be used once per Scene per PokÃ©mon.

* ''Deadly Gambit''
** Prerequisites: 5 Taskmaster Features, Intimidate 6
** Scene â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: Your PokÃ©mon is the target of a foeâ€™s damaging melee attack
** Effect: The triggering attack automatically hits as if it was a Critical Hit. Before damage resolves, your PokÃ©mon may use a 1-Target damaging attack on the foe making the triggering attack as an Interrupt, Frequency allowing, and also automatically hits as a Critical Hit. Damage for both attacks then resolve at the same time.
** Note: This effect bypasses immunity to Critical Hits on your own PokÃ©mon, but not on the target. Though both attacks hit automatically and are Critical Hits, you may still roll to activate effects.






''Masters'' of one of the most classic supernatural powers, telekinesis, these skilled psionics can manipulate and move objects with nothing more than a simple thought. As their powers grow, they become able to lift themselves off the ground or even incapacitate a foe by levitating them.<br>
''With a more honed technique,'' Telekinetics can wield their weapons at a great distance and even summon up pure kinetic energy to send their foes flying. Those who find themselves fighting a Telekinetic are often stymied by their defensive capabilities, as psionic barriers rise up to block their path and subtle distortions in the air divert their attacks.<br>
''Teamed up with'' Psychic Type PokÃ©mon, Telekinetics can easily keep enemies at bay with a continual application of telekinetic pushing or barriers, but their powers are just as well suited toward augmenting the fighting ability of any other type of PokÃ©mon.<br>

* ''Telekinetic''
** [Class] [+Special Attack]
** Prerequisites: Elemental Connection (Psychic), Iron Mind
** Effect: You gain the Telekinetic Capability.

* ''PK Alpha''
** [+Special Attack]
** Prerequisites: Telekinetic
** Effect: You learn the Moves Kinesis and Barrier.

* ''PK Omega''
** [+Special Attack]
** Prerequisites: PK Alpha, Focus 5
** Effect: You learn the Moves Telekinesis and Psychic.

* ''Power of the Mind''
** [+Special Attack]
** Prerequisites: Telekinetic
** Effect: Choose Interference or Levitate. You gain the chosen Ability.

* ''PK Combat''
** [+Special Attack] [Weapon]
** Prerequisites: Telekinetic, Focus 4
** Bind 1 AP â€“ Standard Action
** Effect: You may also wield weapons and items with your Telekinesis capability, as long as you are able to lift them. This means you may use Items and Melee Weapons that normally require you to be adjacent to your target at a range limited only by your Telekinesis. When wielding Weapons with your Telekinesis, you qualify for Moves using Focus instead of Combat and may add your Special Attack instead of your Attack Stat. The Attacks remain Physical, however.

* ''Telekinetic Burst''
** [+Special Attack]
** Prerequisites: PK Combat, Focus 5
** 1 AP â€“ Swift Action
** Effect: You perform a Disarm, Trip, or Push Maneuver using your Telekinetic Capability.

* ''Psionic Overload''
** [+Special Attack]
** Prerequisites: PK Omega, Focus 6
** 2 AP â€“ Swift Action
** Trigger: You hit with Psychic or use another Telekinetic Move
** Effect: The effect of this Feature depends on the Triggering Move.
*** Kinesis: The user of the triggering attack becomes Confused.
*** Barrier: Place 2 additional segments of Barrier, and you may place the Barriers anywhere within 6 meters of yourself. They do not need to remain contiguous, nor does one segment have to touch you.
*** Psychic: The target becomes Vulnerable for one full round.
*** Telekinesis: At the end of each turn that the target remains Lifted, they lose a Tick of Hit Points.






''Itâ€™s hard to keep a secret'' from a Telepath. They are psionics with a mastery of the mind, both their own and othersâ€™. With a thought, they can hone their own minds to better focus in a fight, and they can learn to easily avoid being caught in friendly fire.<br>
''However,'' their most iconic ability, and that which gives them their reputation, is the ability to read the surface thoughts of others. With training, they can even plant thoughts in othersâ€™ heads, guiding them toward lines of thinking that better allow their mind reading to get at secrets that arenâ€™t often on someoneâ€™s mind, or guiding them toward a particular action without them being aware at all of the manipulation.<br>
''Telepaths'' who dedicate themselves to the combat arts find themselves with the advantage of being able to lock onto someoneâ€™s movements through their thoughts, ensuring their attacks hit. They can also telepathically warn their allies of their next move, ensuring they never cause a casualty through friendly fire.

* ''Telepath''
** [Class] [+Special Defense]
** Prerequisites: Elemental Connection (Psychic), Iron Mind, Intuition 3
** 2 AP â€“ Swift Action
** Effect: You gain the Telepathy Capability for the rest of the scene.

* ''Honed Mind''
** [+Special Defense]
** Prerequisites: Telepath
** Effect: You learn the Moves Mind Reader and Calm Mind.

* ''Telepathic Awareness''
** [+Special Defense]
** Prerequisites: Telepath
** Effect: Choose Gentle Vibe or Telepathy. You gain the chosen Ability.

* ''Thought Detection''
** [+Special Defense]
** Prerequisites: Telepathic Awareness
** Scene â€“ Standard Action
** Effect: You become aware of the number of living Humans or PokÃ©mon within X meters of yourself; X is equal to your Focus Rank tripled. PokÃ©mon or Trainers with the Mindlock Capability are not detected by this Ability. You may only use Thought Detection as long as you have the Telepathy Capability.

* ''Telepathic Warning''
** [+Special Defense]
** Prerequisites: Telepathic Awareness, Focus 5 or Intuition 5
** 1 AP â€“ Free Action
** Trigger: You or an Ally use an Attack
** Effect: Youâ€™re able to give your allies heed of attacks. All allies that would be hit by the attack may take a Shift Action as an Interrupt to move out of the area of effect of the attack. Using this leaves discoverable Psychic Residue on each affected ally. You may only use Telepathic Warning as long as you have the Telepath Capability.

* ''Mental Assault''
** [+Special Defense]
** Prerequisites: Telepath, Focus 5 or Intuition 5
** Effect: You learn the Moves Extrasensory and Psyshock.

* ''Suggestion''
** [+Special Defense]
** Prerequisites: Honed Mind, Focus 6 or Intuition 6
** Bind 1 AP â€“ Standard Action
** Target: PokÃ©mon or Trainers
** Effect: You smoothly plant a thought into the subjectâ€™s head that lasts as long as this Feature is Bound. They wonâ€™t know exactly why or how they thought of it; they will naturally assume they thought of it themselves, and their brain will attempt to get there as logically as it can. The target may not necessarily act on the Suggestion, especially if it is against their nature. Using Suggestion to plant a specific thought may cause the target to think about a specific subject, dredging up surface thoughts related to the matter. Using this on a target leaves discoverable psychic residue. You may only use Suggestion as long as you have the Telepathy Capability, though you may keep it Bound without having Telepathy active.






!! Skill Edges

* ''Basic Skills''
** Prerequisites: None
** Rank up one skill from Pathetic (1) to Untrained (2) or from Untrained (2) to Novice (3)
** You may take this edge multiple times

* ''Adept Skills''
** Prerequisites: Level 2
** Rank up one skill from Novice (3) to Adept (4)
** You may take this edge multiple times

* ''Expert Skills''
** Prerequisites: Level 6
** Rank up one skill from Adept (4) to Expert (5)
** You may take this edge multiple times

* ''Master Skills''
** Prerequisites: Level 12
** Rank up one skill from Expert (5) to Master (6)
** You may take this edge multiple times

* ''Skill Stunt''
** Prerequisites: A Skill at Novice (3) or higher
** Choose a specific use of that Skill; when rolling that skill under those circumstances, you may choose to roll one less dice, and instead add +6 to the result.
** You may take this Edge multiple times, choosing a different circumstance each time.

* ''Categoric Inclination''
** Prerequisites: None
** Choose Body, Mind, or Spirit. You gain a +1 Bonus to all Skill Checks of that Category.

* ''Skill Enhancement''
** Prerequisites: None
** Choose two different Skills. You gain a +2 bonus to each of those skills.
** Skill Enhancement may be taken multiple times, but the bonus may be applied only once to a particular skill.

* ''Virtuoso''
** Prerequisites: A Skill at Master Rank, Level 20
** Choose a Skill at Master Rank. Consider that Skill to be effectively â€œRank 8â€ for any Features or effects that depend on Skill Rank.
** Virtuoso may be taken multiple times, but you must choose a different Skill each time.

!! Crafting Edges

* ''Apricorn Balls''
** Prerequisites: Survival 3 or Technology Education 4
** As an Extended Action, you may craft Apricorns into their corresponding PokÃ© Ball. Use of this Feature requires access to a PokÃ© Ball Tool Box.

* ''Basic Balls''
** Prerequisites: Technology Education 3
** You may craft Basic Balls for $100 and Great Balls for $175. Requires access to a PokÃ© Ball Tool Box.

* ''Basic Cooking''
** Prerequisites: Intuition 3
** You may create â€œCandy Barsâ€ or â€œBaby Foodâ€ with cooking ingredients costing $50. You may describe the food in any reasonable manner you like.

* ''Gem Lore''
** Prerequisites: Occult Education 3
** Using an Extended Action you may turn one shard into a gem of a corresponding type, turn 4 shards into the corresponding evolution stone, or break a stone into 4 of the corresponding shards.

** <table><tr><th>Shard Color</th><th>Stone Type</th><th>Gem Types</th></tr>
<tr><td>Red Shards</td><td>Fire Stone</td><td>Fire, Fairy, Psychic</td></tr>
<tr><td>Orange Shards</td><td>Shiny Stone</td><td>Normal, Fighting, Dragon</td></tr>
<tr><td>Yellow Shards</td><td>Thunder Stone</td><td>Electric, Rock, Steel</td></tr>
<tr><td>Green Shards</td><td>Leaf Stone</td><td>Bug, Grass, Ground</td></tr>
<tr><td>Blue Shards</td><td>Water Stone</td><td>Water, Ice, Flying</td></tr>
<tr><td>Violet Shards</td><td>Dusk Stone</td><td>Poison, Dark, Ghost</td></tr></table>


* ''Green Thumb''
** Prerequisites: General Education 3 or Survival 3
** You know how to grow Apricorns and Tier 1 Berries using a Portable Grower or Fertilized Soil.

* ''PokÃ© Ball Repair''
** Prerequisites: Basic Balls or Apricorn Balls
** You may attempt to fix any PokÃ© Ball that has failed to capture a PokÃ©mon and broke. Make a Technology Check with a DC of 15. If you succeed, the PokÃ© Ball is fixed and is treated as if it had not broken. If you fail, the ball is permanently broken. Requires access to a PokÃ© Ball Tool Box.

* ''Repel Crafter''
** Prerequisites: Medicine Education 3 or Technology Education 3
** Create a Repel for $100 or a Super Repel for $150. Requires access to a Chemistry Set.

* ''Tag Scribe''
** Prerequisites: Occult Education 3
** Special - Extended Action
** You create a Cleanse Tag. This may be used a number of times each day equal to half your Occult Education Rank.

!! PokÃ©mon Training Edges

* ''Beast Master''
** Prerequisite: Intimidate 3
**  You may use Intimidate instead of Command to make Pokemon at 0 or 1 Loyalty obey your commands.
** You may also use Intimidate instead of Command to determine the limits and Bonus Experience from Training.

* ''Breeder''
** Prerequisites: PokÃ©mon Education 3
** If you are able to give two PokÃ©mon that are compatible for breeding time alone, you may make a PokÃ©mon Education Check with a DC of 12. If you succeed, the PokÃ©mon are guaranteed to produce an egg if you leave them alone for an amount of time the GM specifies, between 4 and 24 hours.
** (Altered from original: Core pg.53)

* ''Grace''
** Prerequisites: Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition Rank 3
** Your PokÃ©mon may consume and benefit from 2 more Poffins each.
** If this PokÃ©mon is traded to a Trainer without the Grace feature, these extra dice from additional Poffins are not lost, but a Trainer without Grace may not benefit from more than 6 Dice gained from Poffins.
** You may always use any of the Skills that are prerequisites for Grace in the Introduction Stage of a Contest to roll for Contest Stat Dice of any kind.

* ''Groomer''
** Prerequisites: PokÃ©mon Education 3
** You know how to effectively groom your PokÃ©mon with access to a Groomerâ€™s Kit. You may groom up to 6 PokÃ©mon in one hour.
** Grooming PokÃ©mon may count as an hour of Training, and you may apply Experience Training, teach Poke-Edges, and apply any Features that could be applied during Training. If you apply Experience Training from Grooming, use your General Education or PokÃ©mon Education Rank to determine Bonus Experience gained during Training.
** A PokÃ©mon that has been Groomed also gains a +1d6 Bonus to the Introduction Roll of a Contest for the rest of the day.

* ''Paleontologist''
** Prerequisites: PokÃ©mon Education 3 or Survival 3
** You can identify fossils with a DC 10 PokÃ©mon Education or Survival Check. You know how to operate Reanimation Machines and can use them to revive Fossils.

* ''Train the Reserves''
** Prerequisites: Command 3
** You may apply Experience Training to a number of Pokemon equal to twice your Command Rank, instead of equal to your Command Rank.
** Note: Beast Master or Groomer do not change the Skill that this Edge uses.

* ''Trainer of Champions''
** Prerequisites: Command 5
** Whenever you apply Experience Training to a Pokemon, they gain an additional +5 Experience.

!! Combat Edges

* ''Athletic Initiative''
** Prerequisites: Athletics 4
** You learn the Move Agility.

* ''Bad Mood''
** Prerequisites: Intimidate 5
** Your Critical Hit Range is increased by +1 if you are suffering from a Persistent Status Affliction. Your Critical Hit Range is increased by +1 if you are suffering from a Volatile Status Affliction. These stack with each other, giving a total of +2 to Critical Hit Range if you are suffering from both a Persistent and a Volatile Status Affliction.

* ''Basic Martial Arts''
** Prerequisites: Combat 3
** You learn the Move Rock Smash.

* ''Basic Psionics''
** Prerequisites: Elemental Connection (Psychic)
** You learn the Move Confusion.

* ''Charmer''
** Prerequisites: Charm 3
** You learn the Move Baby-Doll Eyes.

* ''Confidence Artist''
** Prerequisites: Guile 3
** You learn the Move Confide.

* ''Demoralize''
** Prerequisites: Intimidate 4
** Whenever you land a Critical Hit on a foe, that foe becomes Vulnerable. Status-Class Moves with an Accuracy Roll can â€œCritâ€ for the purposes of activating this effect on a natural roll of 19 or higher, and any effects that expand your Critical-Hit Range also expand this range.

* ''Dynamism''
** Prerequisites: Guile 3
** Your initiative is increased by your Guile Rank.

* ''Expert Manipulator''
** Prerequisites: Guile 4
** You gain a +2 Opposed Checks with all Manipulate Maneuvers. The â€œOnce per Scene per Foeâ€ Limitation of each Manipulate Maneuver is expended only upon succesfully affecting a foe with that Manipulate Maneuver.

* ''Expert Trickster''
** Prerequisites: Stealth 4
** You gain a +2 Opposed Checks with all Dirty Trick Maneuvers. The â€œOnce per Scene per Foeâ€ Limitation of each Dirty Trick Maneuver is expended only upon successfully affecting a foe with that Dirty Trick Maneuver.

* ''Flustering Charisma''
** Prerequisites: Charm 4 or Guile 4
** When you hit with a Move with the Social keyword, the target takes a -2 penalty to Save Checks against Volatile Status Afflictions for 1 full round.

* ''Intimidating Presence''
** Prerequisites: Intimidate 3
** You learn the Move Leer.

* ''Kip Up''
** Prerequisites: Acrobatics 5
** You may stand up from being Tripped as a Swift Action

* ''Leader''
** Prerequisites: Command 4
** You learn the Move After You.

* ''Nimble Movement''
** Prerequisites: Acrobatics 4 or Stealth 4
** Whenever you Disengage, you Shift 2 meters instead of 1.

* ''Slippery''
** Prerequisites: Stealth 3
** You may use your Stealth Skill when defending in Opposed Grapple, Push, or Trip checks.
** When Grappling, if you win an Opposed Check when using Stealth, you must choose to end the Grapple (you cannot choose to gain Dominance).

* ''Smooth''
** Prerequisites: Charm 5 or Focus 5
** You gain +4 Evasion against Moves with the Social keyword, and gain a +2 Bonus on Save Checks against Rage and Infatuation.

* ''Sneakâ€™s Tricks''
** Prerequisites: Stealth 4
** You learn the Move Astonish.

* ''Stamina''
** Prerequisites: Athletics 5 or Combat 5
** Whenever you Take a Breather or take Massive Damage or a Critical Hit, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Athletics or Combat Rank after the triggering action has resolved.

* ''Survival Drive''
** Prerequisites: Survival 4
** You learn the Move Bulk Up.

* ''Throwing Masteries''
** Prerequisites: Acrobatics 4
** Increase the Throwing Range of your PokÃ© Balls, Ranged Weapons, and other small items by +2.

* ''Weapon of Choice''
** Prerequisites: A Feature with the [Weapon] tag
** Choose a specific weapon type. You gain a +2 Bonus on Opposed Rolls to prevent being disarmed while wielding weapons of your chosen type. If you would be disarmed anyway, you may pay 1 AP to prevent yourself from being Disarmed.

* ''Work Up''
** Prerequisites: Focus 4
** You learn the Move Work Up.

!! Other Edges

* ''Acrobat''
** Prerequisites: Acrobatics 3
** Increase your Jump and Long Jump Capabilities by +1 each.

* ''Art of Stealth''
** Prerequisites: Stealth 5
** You gain the Stealth Capability.

* ''Elemental Connection''
** Prerequisites: None
** Choose an Elemental Type. You gain a +2 bonus to Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, and Intuition Checks targeting PokÃ©mon of that Type.
** You may not take Elemental Connection if you have the Mystic Senses Edge, and you may not take Mystic Senses if you have Elemental Connection.

* ''Instinctive Aptitude''
** Prerequisite: Intuition 4
** Whenever you spend AP to raise your roll on an Accuracy Roll or Skill Check, you get a +2 bonus instead of +1. This cannot be used on Rolls made by your PokÃ©mon.

* ''Instruction''
** Prerequisite: General Education 3
** Whenever you aid an ally in an Assisted Skill Check using an Education Skill you have at Novice (3) Rank or higher, add your full Rank value as a bonus to their roll instead of half.

* ''Iron Mind''
** Prerequisites: Focus 3
** You become aware of all attempts to read your mind with Telepathy, whether the attempt is successful or not.

* ''Medic Training''
** Prerequisites: Medicine Education 3
** When you use Restorative Items on others, they do not forfeit their next turn.

* ''Mounted Prowess''
** Prerequisites: Acrobatics 3 or Athletics 3
** You automatically succeed at Acrobatics and Athletics Checks made to mount a PokÃ©mon, and you gain a +3 Bonus to all Acrobatics and Athletics Checks made to remain Mounted.

* ''Mystic Senses''
** Prerequisites: Intuition 3
** You may use Intuition instead of Charm to improve the disposition of Wild PokÃ©mon.
** You may not take Mystic Senses if you have the Elemental Connection Edge, and you may not take Elemental Connection if you have Mystic Senses.

* ''Poke Psychologist''
** Prerequisites: PokÃ©mon Education 3
** You may use your PokÃ©mon Education Skill instead of Charm, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition when making general Skill checks to interact with PokÃ©mon or to raise or lower disposition.

* ''Power Boost''
** Prerequisites: Athletics 5
** Increase your Power Capability by +2

* ''Scholar''
** Prerequisites: General Education 5
** You gain a +1 Bonus to Skill Checks with General Education, Medicine Education, Occult Education, PokÃ©mon Education, Technology Education, and Survival.

* ''Swimmer''
** Prerequisites: Athletics 3 or Survival 3
** You gain a +2 bonus to your Swim Speed. You may spend X minutes underwater before you begin to suffocate, where X is the higher of your Athletics or Survival Ranks.

* ''Traveler''
** Prerequisites: Survival 3
** You may use Survival instead of Athletics and Acrobatics to determine your Power Capability, High Jump, and Long Jump values.
** Determine your Overland Movement by substituting your Survival Rank for the lower of your Athletics or Acrobatics Rank.

* ''Wallrunner''
** Prerequisites: Acrobatics 5
** You may run on vertical surfaces both vertically and horizontally for up to your Acrobatics Rank in meters before jumping off.

!! Sci-Fi Edges

* ''Defensive Hacking''
** Prerequisites: Technology Education 4, Focus 3, Datajack Augmentation
** Effect: You may add your Focus Ranks as additional Damage Reduction while in digital battles. You may apply this Damage Reduction to Technology Education attacks.

* ''Dream Architect''
** Prerequisites: Intuition 4, PokÃ©mon Education 4, or Technology Education 4
** Effect: You know how to operate Dream Machines and can use them to study and influence a PokÃ©monâ€™s dreams.

* ''Emergency Repairs''
** Prerequisites: Technology Education 3
** Effect: You may repair vehicles as a standard action by making a Technology Education roll. You pay the amount of your roll and repair that much Hit Point damage to the vehicle. If the vehicle has any Breaches you may Patch one of them. Patched Breaches no longer count towards Breach Security but still count toward Breach Capacity.

* ''Glitched Existence''
** Prerequisites: Exposure to Glitch Phenomena, GM Permission
** Effect: You gain +2 to all Skill rolls to deal with Glitch phenomena.

* ''Gravity Training''
** Prerequisites: Novice Athletics or Focus
** Effect: You gain the Gravitic Tolerance capability at a value of 1-3 or 2-4.

* ''PokÃ©bot Training''
** Prerequisites: Technology Education 3
** Effect: You may control a PokÃ©bot with Complexity up to your Technology Rank by using a PokÃ©mon turn.

* ''Psychic Navigator''
** Prerequisites: Elemental Connection (Psychic), Perception 4 or Focus 4
** Effect: You gain the Psychic Navigator Capability.

* ''Quick Case''
** Prerequisites: Technology Education 3
** Effect: You may remove a Case from a PokÃ© Ball as a Swift Action. You may apply a Case to a PokÃ© Ball as a Shift Action. (Normally these would be Shift and Standard Actions respectively)

* ''Shock Resistance''
** Prerequisites: Technology Education 3
** Effect: You donâ€™t suffer Augmentation Shock from Electric Type damage unless it is Massive Damage.






* Trainers have a max level of 50
* Trainers earn one level with each milestone (such as a Gym Badge), or with 10 Trainer Xp (from minor achievements such as catching pokemon)
* Trainers gain one ''Stat Point'' every level
* Trainers gain one ''Edge'' every ''Even'' level
* Trainers gain one ''Feature'' every ''Odd'' level
* ''Lv 2 - Adept Skills'': Gain all bonuses
** Allowed to rank up skills to Adept (4)
** +1 Skill Edge, but it may not be used to rank up to Adept
* ''Lv 5 - Amateur Trainer'': Choose one bonus
** On every even level-up up to 10, you gain 1 bonus stat point that must be spent on Atk or S.Atk. You gain 2 stat points for levels 2 and 4 retroactively.
** Gain 1 General Feature
* ''Lv 6 - Expert Skills'': Gain all bonuses
** Allowed to rank up to Expert (5)
** +1 Skill Edge, but it may not be used to rank up to Expert
* ''Lv 10 - Capable Trainer'': Choose one bonus
** On every even level-up up to 20, gain 1 bonus stat point that must be spent on Atk or S.Atk
** Gain 2 Edges
* ''Lv 12 - Master Skills'': Gain all bonuses
** Allowed to rank up  skills to Master (6)
** +1 skill edge, but it may not be used to rank up to Master
* ''Lv 20 - Veteran Trainer'': Choose one bonus
** On every even level-up up to 30, gain 1 bonus stat point that must be spent on Atk or S.Atk
** Gain 2 edges
* ''Lv 30 - Elite Trainer'': Choose one bonus
** On every even level-up up to 40, gain 1 bonus stat point that must be spent on Atk or S.Atk
** Gain 2 edges
** Gain 1 general feature
* ''Lv 40 - Champion'': Choose one bonus
** On every even level-up up to 50, gain 1 bonus stat point that must be spent on Atk or S.Atk
** Gain 2 edges
** Gain 1 general feature

! Retraining
* You may spend 2 Trainer Exp to retrain a Feature
* You may spend 1 Trainer Exp to retrain an Edge
* You may spend 1 Trainer Exp to move 1 Stat Point

* You may not retrain an edge or feature that acts as a prerequisite for another you have, including edges used to raise a skill to the required rank.
* You may not retrain features or edges with a permanent effect you have already used, such as move tutor or type shift.
* Retraining is done at GM approval. Options to retrain for free may be given at arbitrary points.

** Size: Small
** Weight Class: 1
* Breeding
** Gender Ratio : 87.5% M / 12.5% F
